abstract: South Sudan's Pres Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar fail to reach peace agreement in meeting orchestrated by Kenyan Pres Uhuru Kenyatta; rebel forces capture strategic city of Malakal.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the rebels said that “progress is being made” in negotiations to end South Sudan’s civil war, even as forces had seized the strategic city of Malakal.

headline.main: Peace Eludes South Sudan as Rivals Hold Talks
headline.print_headline: Peace Eludes South Sudan as Rivals Hold Talks

snippet: A spokesman for the rebels said that “progress is being made” in negotiations to end South Sudan’s civil war, even as forces had seized the strategic city of Malakal.
